intro: Massonia nivea, commonly known as the snow massonia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features fleshy, blue-green leaves that are covered in a fine, powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped white flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements make it a desirable addition to arid landscapes.
